make.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to produce something, for example by putting the different parts of it together
make.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: I’m going to show you how to make a box for your tools.
A family of mice had made their nest in the roof.
She made her own wedding dress.
The company has been making quality furniture for over 200 years.
They met while they were making a film.
Make a list of all the things you need.
He made her a toy horse, using just some straw and bamboo twigs.
She’s very good at making things from old scraps of material.
make.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: used with some nouns to say that someone does something
make.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: I can’t make a decision just yet.
I need to make a quick phone call.
You could have made more effort to talk to him.
He made no attempt to apologize.
There are a few points I’d like to make.
The police were called but no arrests were made.
I suppose we should make a start on cleaning this room.
make.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to cook or prepare food or drink
make.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: When was the last time you made a cake?
John was making breakfast in the kitchen.
Who’s going to make the tea?
make.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to cause something to happen, or cause a particular state or condition
make.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Its beautiful beaches make this a highly popular area with tourists.
It was this movie which made him a star.
His attitude made him very unpopular with colleagues.
The photo makes her look much older than she really is.
The president has made it clear that he is not going to change his mind.
The use of computers has made it possible for more people to work from home.
Over 80,000 people attended, making it the biggest sporting event in the area.
make something the best/worst/most expensive etc
I like him because he makes me laugh.
make.translation[0].definitions[3].note_: In written English, people often use cause somebody to do something rather than make somebody do something, as it sounds more formal:
His attitude caused him to be unpopular with colleagues.
make.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: to force someone to do something
make.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: My parents always make me do my homework before I go out.
I was made to wait four hours before I was examined by a doctor.
make.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: to cause a mark, hole etc to appear
make.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: Make a hole in the paper.
The cup has made a mark on the table.
make.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: to succeed in achieving a particular position, rate etc
make.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: He was never good enough to make the team.
I don’t think we’ll make the deadline.
make.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: The plan could cost you more than you would make.
They made a profit of £140 million.
His one aim in life was to make money.
She hopes to make a living (=earn the money she needs to live) from writing children’s books.
He’s made a fortune (=earned a lot of money) selling computers on the Internet.
How easy is it to make money out of gardening?
make.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: to have the qualities that are necessary for a particular job, use, or purpose
make.translation[0].definitions[8].examp: I’m sure you will make a very good teacher.
The hall would make an ideal venue for a wedding reception.
An old cardboard box makes a comfortable bed for a kitten.
make.translation[0].definitions[8].note_: Make is a linking verb in this meaning It links the subject of the sentence with an adjective and noun
The leaves make a pretty table decoration
make.translation[0].definitions[9].defin: to be a particular amount when added together
make.translation[0].definitions[9].examp: There are nine people coming, plus me, which makes ten.
make.translation[0].definitions[10].defi: used to say what you have calculated a number to be
make.translation[0].definitions[11].defi: to achieve a particular score in a sports game
make.translation[0].definitions[12].defi: to arrive at or get to a particular place, especially when it is difficult
make.translation[0].definitions[12].exam: I don’t think we’re going to make the town before nightfall.
make.translation[0].definitions[13].defi: to make something complete or successful
make.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0]: You use this when saying which material is used to make something The material has not been changed and can still be recognized
The table is made of wood
The ring was made of solid gold
make.translation[0].note_box[0].items[1]: You use this especially when the materials used to make something have been completely changed and cannot be recognized
The drink is made from cherries
make.translation[0].note_box[0].items[2]: You use this when saying who makes something
The pots are made by local craftsmen
make.translation[0].note_box[0].items[3]: You also use this when saying how something is made
Tar is made by heating coal to a high temperature
make.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: used about things you make yourself, or things that are made in a factory
Diane makes all her own clothes.
My camera was made in China.
produce
to make something in large quantities to be sold, or to make something as the result of a natural process
The factory produces high-quality steel.
Japan produces some of the most advanced mobile phones.
The pancreas is a gland in your body which produces hormones.
create
to make something new and original
Tarantino created a whole new style of films.
Many companies invest a lot of money in creating new products.
Potter was famous for creating characters such as ‘Peter Rabbit’.
This technique is used to create images of beautiful forests.
manufacture
to make machines, cars, equipment etc in factories
The company manufactures aircraft parts.
mass-produce
to make very large quantities of something in a factory
They developed a way to mass-produce the drug.
develop
to design and make something new over a period of time
In 1962, Enders developed an effective vaccine against measles.
The company is developing new anti-virus software.
form
to make something as the result of a natural process or chemical reaction
Hydrogen and oxygen combine to form water.
The research will help us understand how planets are formed.
generate
to make something such as heat, electricity, or power
Wind can be used to generate electricity.
make.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: the name of a particular product or of the company that makes it
make.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: It’s one of the most popular makes of satellite phone on the market.
make.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to produce something by working or by using industrial processes
make.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The company makes and sells pumps and motors.
a label on the toy read ‘ made in Taiwan’
make.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: The purpose of this business is to make money.
He expects to make $100,000 this year.
make.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: to earn the money you need to live
make.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: He makes a good living selling used cars.
make.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: to make more or less money than you spend
make.translation[2].definitions[3].examp: The company made a pretax profit of £309,000.
make.translation[2].definitions[4].defin: if a financial institution makes a market in particular shares etc, it has them available for people and organizations to buy at all times
make.translation[2].definitions[4].examp: The company said it would no longer make a market in government securities.
make.translation[2].definitions[5].defin: if you make good on a promise or loan, you do what you promised or give back money that is owed
make.translation[2].definitions[5].examp: How does Honda plan to make good its pledge?
Pirelli intends to make good on any trading losses by its allies.
make.translation[2].definitions[6].defin: to be successful in a particular activity or business
make.translation[2].definitions[6].examp: This is a tough business, but I hope you make it.
He failed in his efforts to make it big in Los Angeles.
make.translation[2].definitions[7].defin: to cause either great success or complete failure
make.translation[2].definitions[7].examp: They were well aware that large scale investment would make or break the company.
This is a make-or-break year for us.
make.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: a particular name for a product made by a particular company
make.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The goods were the manufacturer’s own make.
Its devices can work with many different makes of computer.
make.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: to be always trying to get an advantage for yourself
